cards.frontContent: What is the purpose of the <head> element in HTML?
cards.backContent: The <head> element contains meta-information about the HTML document, such as the title, character encoding, and links to external resources.

cards.frontContent: What is the purpose of the <body> element in HTML?
cards.backContent: The <body> element represents the content of an HTML document, such as text, images, links, and other multimedia.

cards.frontContent: What is the correct HTML element for creating a hyperlink?
cards.backContent: The <a> element (anchor) is used to create hyperlinks in HTML.

cards.frontContent: How do you create a numbered list in HTML?
cards.backContent: Use the <ol> element to create an ordered (numbered) list.

cards.frontContent: How do you create a bullet list in HTML?
cards.backContent: Use the <ul> element to create an unordered (bullet) list.

cards.frontContent: What is the purpose of the element in HTML?
cards.backContent: The element is used to embed images in an HTML document.

cards.frontContent: What is the purpose of the <div> element in HTML?
cards.backContent: The <div> element is a block-level container used to group other HTML elements together for styling and layout purposes.

cards.frontContent:
What has roots as nobody sees,
Is taller than trees,
Up, up it goes,
And yet never grows?

Voiceless it cries,
Wingless flutters,
Toothless bites,
Mouthless mutters.

An eye in a blue face
Saw an eye in a green face.
'That eye is like to this eye'
Said the first eye,
'But in low place,
Not in high place.'

It cannot be seen, cannot be felt,
Cannot be heard, cannot be smelt.
It lies behind stars and under hills,
And empty holes it fills.
It comes first and follows after,
Ends life, kills laughter.

A box without hinges, key, or lid,
Yet golden treasure inside is hid.

Alive without breath,
As cold as death;
Never thirsty, ever drinking,
All in mail never clinking.

No-legs lay on one-leg,
two-legs sat near on three-legs,
four-legs got some.
cards.backContent: Fish on a little table, man on a stool, the cat gets the scraps.

cards.frontContent: Is this deck deeply nested in folders?
Is this deck deeply nested in folders?
